title: A new global order as economic challenges persist | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: 2025 marked a new economic world order, marred by global shocks and trade wars.  Fears of a US recession were replaced with stock markets hitting record highs.  In April, Donald Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariffs on allies and enemies shredded the global trading system that had delivered economic growth for decades.  Tensions between the world's big superpowers, the United States and China escalated before the Trump Administration hit pause and the TACO trade hit Wall Street.   Massive investments in artificial intelligence are driving global markets.  Huge amounts of money continue to be invested in data centres, factories and technology.   Australia started 2025 in a cost-of-living crisis.  The Reserve Bank had held interest rates steady at 4.35 Per cent for more than year, punishing Australians with large mortgages, as it tried to force down inflation. Consumer spending slumped.  Then in February came the first of three rates cuts after 13 hikes.  For a while, it looked like inflation had been tamed but consumer price rises accelerated in the year to October, above the RBA's target range, sparking calls for interest rate hikes in 2026.   Some of the nation's top economists spoke to business reporter Daniel Ziffer about the big economic issues of 2025 and what they think we can expect in 2026. #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Super fund HESTA punished for locking members of their accounts | The Business | ABC NEWS
description: The financial regulator has sounded the alarm on superannuation giant HESTA for its handling of a seven-week planned outage that left 1.1 million members unable to access their money. APRA highlighted concerns about HESTA's risk management and board government during its transition to a new administration provider, and said the process resulted in a "severe, prolonged disruption" and "direct harm" to many Australians.  It follows months of reporting by business reporter Adelaide Miller on the consequences of the disruption for some members.  #ABCBusiness Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-12-11/super-fund-hesta-hit-with-extra-conditions-apra-governance-risk/106128664  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Australian dollar slips after worse-than-expected job figures | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian economy shed 21,000 jobs in November, while the unemployment rate remained unchanged at 4.3%.  The Australian dollar slipped to 66.3 US cents after market pricing for an interest rate cut in February fell slightly. title: Trump suggests Zelenskyy is using the Ukraine war to avoid holding an election | ABC NEWS
description: Ukraine's president Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he's open to the possibility of holding an election in Ukraine and has called for other countries to stop applying pressure. It comes after US President Donald Trump repeated claims he's using the excuse of war to avoid holding elections. title: IN FULL: WA authorities provide update on a bushfire burning in Perth suburbs | ABC NEWS
description: Authorities held a media conference about a bushfire in Perth's south east in the Kennewick area. The fire started about midday and burnt quickly to the north-east through 93 hectares of land.  100 firefighters are working to stop the blaze.  No homes have been lost but one shed is gone.  Another fire is still at emergency level in the Bullsbrook area.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Indigenous deaths in custody highest in 45yrs with urgent calls for change | ABC NEWS
description: At just 3.8% of Australia's population, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people take up a disproportionate share of Australia's prisoners. 33 of the 113 people who died in custody in the 2024-25 financial year were First Nations. Advocates and criminal law experts are calling it a national crisis with a need for urgent change. title: Court of criminal appeal to decide if hit-and-run driver Jake Danby will be resentenced | ABC NEWS
description: The Northern Territory Court of Criminal Appeal is yet to decide whether to resentence fatal hit and run driver, Jake Danby, after hearing submissions today.  Danby was sentenced to a 12-month intensive community corrections order after hitting two Aboriginal pedestrians with his car in 2024, fleeing the scene and then boasting about it over text.  Director of Public Prosecutions filed an appeal on the grounds the sentence was manifestly inadequate. Court reporter Olivana Lathouris has more for ABC News Northern Territory. title: US proposes mandatory disclosure of social media history for tourists | ABC NEWS
description: Australians, New Zealanders, and citizens of 40 other visa-exempt countries could be forced to disclose five years' worth of social media history when entering the United States. The proposal from the Trump administration is part of a bid to tighten US borders, citing national security concerns. It would bring the rules for impacted countries in line with those for tourist visa applicants. title: Investor loses $300k in alleged bond scam advertised on Facebook | ABC NEWS
description: Tech giant Meta is under scrutiny after running sponsored Facebook posts for a company that lured Australian investors into an allegedly fraudulent bond scheme. The corporate watchdog is investigating claims investors were defrauded of tens of millions of dollars by GIM Trading. Advocates say social media platforms should bear more responsibility in protecting their users from scams. title: North Queensland skydiver survives “heart-stopping” jump by cutting his tangled parachute | ABC News
description: Dramatic video of a skydiver who became snagged on a plane mid-air above Mission Beach in North Queensland has been released by the Australian Transport Safety Bureau, with an investigation finding the release handle of the chute became caught on the plane’s wing flap.  #ABCNewsQld by Lexy Hamilton-Smith  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE Read more here: https://www.abc.net.au/news/2025-12-11/video-of-skydiver-cutting-parachute/106131480  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: PM sidesteps political entitlements talk as calls for review grow | ABC NEWS
description: A growing number of politicians say they're open to a review of taxpayer-funded entitlements amid a string of controversial expense claims made by Minister Anika Wells. Anthony Albanese has brushed aside questions about the discourse, instead trying to shift focus onto the government's teen social media ban. The opposition has accused the prime minister of shirking responsibility for Anika Wells' use of entitlements. title: Yodelling ruled a 'protected artform' by the United Nations | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The Swiss tradition of yodelling has been inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage List. The singing style's roots have been traced to the Central Alps, where herders once used the echoing calls to send messages across valleys and summon their flocks. Professor of Yodelling Nadja Räss spoke to Manny Tsigas about the significance of the UN's decision, and treated 'The World' to a demonstration of the traditional singing style. title: India's biggest airline under scrutiny as thousands of flights cancelled | The World | ABC NEWS
description: India's aviation regulator has stepped in to oversee the operations of the country's largest airline after it was forced to cancel thousands of flights last week. IndiGo has been ordered to cut 10% of its winter schedule after it failed to plan ahead for a new wave of rules aimed at improving conditions for their pilots. Aviation safety expert Amit Singh speaks to Manny Tsigas about the impact of the cuts. title: Cuban neighbourhoods plunged into darkness as power grid fails to cope | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Cuba is in the midst of a profound energy crisis, with some households seeing blackouts for more than 20 hours a day. They're being blamed on fuel shortages and an ageing power grid, as well as damage left in the wake of October's Hurricane Melissa. Rebecca Johnston reports.
